channel.title: Two Vertices Aren't Selected
channel.description:
I know this is a stupid and sort of unimportant question but it PISSES ME OFF!!!
So see here, I'm like "Yay, making a katana, yay" [IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/296esuf.jpg[/img] And then I'm like "I'ma rope me up some vertices" [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/2yljn6r.jpg[/img] And then I'm like "WTF CAN YOU COUNT??" [IMG]http://i35.tinypic.com/svlw7k.jpg[/img] Then I gave up and came here. [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/2ahy6wx.jpg[/img]
So anyone know how to fix that? It's probably something stupid, but I wasn't going to figure it out on my own, so... =P Won't respond for a while though, I'm gonna go see Quantum of Solace ;)

item.title: Two Vertices Aren't Selected
item.dc:creator: @pluh1 pluh1
item.description:
@pluh1 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:3, topic:249454”]ok, this is an easy fix. so heres ur object panel:

/\ Objects
[Blah] [Blah][Misc]
Obj1
Obj2

now under Misc. go “Merge All”.
then reselect the 2 verticies and hit [CTRL] [J] (join verticies)
and your done.[/quote]
Yeah, I totally thought it was gonna be a problem with the objects, but I had to go so I couldn’t experiment. Thanks though!

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:249454”]Why are you trying to join vertices anyway?

P.s, quantum of solace wasn’t very good, saw it 2 weeks ago :([/quote]
I need to join vertices mainly because it makes it look better, and no faces will overlap or anything, anything that would make the model look sloppy.
[Off Topic] And I thought it was alright, but it wasn’t really anything special. Just another Bond movie. They really lost their kick after Pierce Brosnan was out of the picture. Sean Connery was pretty good, and Daniel Craig isn’t really bad, it’s just that the series doesn’t really have a point anymore. It’s as if the series is falling apart like the world is in the movie. =/ But whatever, already saw it.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Vertices Aren't Selected
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

ok, this is an easy fix. so heres ur object panel:

/\ Objects
[Blah] [Blah][Misc]
Obj1
Obj2

now under Misc. go “Merge All”.
then reselect the 2 verticies and hit [CTRL] [J] (join verticies)
and your done.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pluh1 pluh1
item.description:
@pluh1 wrote:

I know this is a stupid and sort of unimportant question but it PISSES ME OFF!!!

So see here, I’m like “Yay, making a katana, yay”

And then I’m like “I’ma rope me up some vertices”

2yljn6r.jpg712×735

And then I’m like “WTF CAN YOU COUNT??”

Then I gave up and came here.

So anyone know how to fix that? It’s probably something stupid, but I wasn’t going to figure it out on my own, so… =P
Won’t respond for a while though, I’m gonna go see Quantum of Solace
